revised_title: Determining Depths and Extinction Coefficients of Shallow Water Using Air Photography and Colour Filters
tldr: The authors developed a method called the 'Transparency Method' to determine depths and extinction coefficients of shallow water using air photography and colour filters. This method measures the relative brightness of the sea-bed through the water and can be used for various purposes such as constructing charts, studying sandbars, and controlling erosion and pollution.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Coastal Mapping
